item.title: By: Antonio

item.title: By: robert
item.dc:creator: robert
item.description: Thanks for the feedback. If you can show me an better/easier way to generate documentation for TypeScript. I'm all ears.
item.content:encoded: Thanks for the feedback. If you can show me an better/easier way to generate documentation for TypeScript. I’m all ears.

item.title: By: Matthew
item.dc:creator: Matthew
item.content:encoded:
No offense, but this isn’t a very good solution…

/**
* @property isEnabled
* @type {boolean}
* @default false
* @protected
*/
public isEnabled:boolean = false;

The great thing about JSDoc for JavaScript is that it can take standard-looking, minimal comments and generate relatively useful documentation. If you have to basically rewrite every declaration into your doc comments, then you either can’t use refactoring tools or have to deal with the fact that your documentation is going to get out of date fast.
